availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Gibson Darby (Caldwell County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, resident. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Son of George F. Darby and Mary Wyatt Darby. Student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Caldwell County in 1861. Resident of Fredonia in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 316b.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 833.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 17, Caldwell County, Kentucky, 1865, p. 138.
"Andrew Gibson Darby (1839-1918)," Find A Grave, Memorial #80328274, accessed April 15, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80328274.
KYR-0001-020-0009.
